segment.source: Deploying the UE-V Agent
segment.target: Deploying the UE-V Agent

segment.source: Deploying the UE-V Agent
segment.target: Deploying the UE-V Agent

segment.source: Deploying the UE-V Agent
segment.target: Deploying the UE-V Agent

segment.source: The Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) agent must run on each computer that uses UE-V to roam application and Windows settings.
segment.target: The Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) agent must run on each computer that uses UE-V to roam application and Windows settings.

segment.source: A single installer file, AgentSetup.exe, installs the UE-V agent on both 32-bit and 64-bit operating systems.
segment.target: A single installer file, AgentSetup.exe, installs the UE-V agent on both 32-bit and 64-bit operating systems.

segment.source: The command-line parameters of the UE-V Agent are the following:
segment.target: The command-line parameters of the UE-V Agent are the following:

segment.source: AgentSetup.exe command-line parameters
segment.target: AgentSetup.exe command-line parameters

segment.source: Command-line parameter
segment.target: Command-line parameter

segment.source: Definition
segment.target: Definition

segment.source: Notes
segment.target: Notes

segment.source: /help or /h or /?
segment.target: /help or /h or /?

segment.source: Displays the AgentSetup.exe usage dialog.
segment.target: Displays the AgentSetup.exe usage dialog.

segment.source: SettingsStoragePath
segment.target: SettingsStoragePath

segment.source: Indicates the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path that defines where settings are stored.
segment.target: Indicates the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path that defines where settings are stored.

segment.source: %username% or %computername% environment variables are accepted.
segment.target: %username% or %computername% environment variables are accepted.

segment.source: Scripting may require escaped variables.
segment.target: Scripting may require escaped variables.

segment.source: Default: none (Active Directory user home)
segment.target: Default: none (Active Directory user home)

segment.source: SettingsTemplateCatalogPath
segment.target: SettingsTemplateCatalogPath

segment.source: Indicates the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path that defines the location that was checked for new settings location templates.
segment.target: Indicates the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path that defines the location that was checked for new settings location templates.

segment.source: Only required for custom settings location templates
segment.target: Only required for custom settings location templates

segment.source: RegisterMSTemplates
segment.target: RegisterMSTemplates

segment.source: Specifies whether the default Microsoft templates should be registered during installation.
segment.target: Specifies whether the default Microsoft templates should be registered during installation.

segment.source: True | False
segment.target: True | False

segment.source: Default: True
segment.target: Default: True

segment.source: SyncMethod
segment.target: SyncMethod

segment.source: Specifies which synchronization method should be used.
segment.target: Specifies which synchronization method should be used.

segment.source: OfflineFiles | None
segment.target: OfflineFiles | None

segment.source: Default: OfflineFiles
segment.target: Default: OfflineFiles

segment.source: SyncTimeoutInMilliseconds
segment.target: SyncTimeoutInMilliseconds

segment.source: Specifies the number of milliseconds that the computer waits before timeout when it retrieves user settings from the settings storage location.
segment.target: Specifies the number of milliseconds that the computer waits before timeout when it retrieves user settings from the settings storage location.

segment.source: Default: 2000 milliseconds
segment.target: Default: 2000 milliseconds

segment.source: (wait up to 2 seconds)
segment.target: (wait up to 2 seconds)

segment.source: SyncEnabled
segment.target: SyncEnabled

segment.source: Specifies whether UE-V synchronization is enabled or disabled.
segment.target: Specifies whether UE-V synchronization is enabled or disabled.

segment.source: True | False
segment.target: True | False

segment.source: Default: True
segment.target: Default: True

segment.source: MaxPackageSizeInBytes
segment.target: MaxPackageSizeInBytes

segment.source: Specifies a settings package file size in bytes when the UE-V agent reports that files exceed the threshold.
segment.target: Specifies a settings package file size in bytes when the UE-V agent reports that files exceed the threshold.

segment.source: size
segment.target: size

segment.source: Default: none (no warning threshold)
segment.target: Default: none (no warning threshold)

segment.source: CEIPEnabled
segment.target: CEIPEnabled

segment.source: Specifies the setting for participation in the Customer Experience Improvement program.
segment.target: Specifies the setting for participation in the Customer Experience Improvement program.

segment.source: If set to true, then installer information is uploaded to the Microsoft Customer Experience Improvement Program site.
segment.target: If set to true, then installer information is uploaded to the Microsoft Customer Experience Improvement Program site.

segment.source: If set to false, then no information is uploaded.
segment.target: If set to false, then no information is uploaded.

segment.source: True | False
segment.target: True | False

segment.source: Default: False
segment.target: Default: False

segment.source: During installation, the SettingsStoragePath command-line parameter specifies the settings storage location for the settings values.
segment.target: During installation, the SettingsStoragePath command-line parameter specifies the settings storage location for the settings values.

segment.source: A settings storage location can be defined before deploying the UE-V Agent.
segment.target: A settings storage location can be defined before deploying the UE-V Agent.

segment.source: If no settings storage location is defined, then UE-V uses the Active Directory user Home Directory as the settings storage location.
segment.target: If no settings storage location is defined, then UE-V uses the Active Directory user Home Directory as the settings storage location.

segment.source: When you specify the SettingsStoragePath configuration during setup and use the %username% as part of the value, this will roam the same user settings experience on all computers or sessions that a user logs into.
segment.target: When you specify the SettingsStoragePath configuration during setup and use the %username% as part of the value, this will roam the same user settings experience on all computers or sessions that a user logs into.

segment.source: If you specify the %username%%computername% variables as part of the SettingsStoragePath value, this will preserve the settings experience for each computer.
segment.target: If you specify the %username%%computername% variables as part of the SettingsStoragePath value, this will preserve the settings experience for each computer.

segment.source: Architecture-specific Windows Installer (.msi) files are provided for the UE-V agent installation in addition to the combined 32-bit and 64-bit installer.
segment.target: Architecture-specific Windows Installer (.msi) files are provided for the UE-V agent installation in addition to the combined 32-bit and 64-bit installer.

segment.source: The AgentSetupx86.msi or AgentSetupx64.msi install files are smaller than the AgentSetup.exe file and might streamline the agent deployments.
segment.target: The AgentSetupx86.msi or AgentSetupx64.msi install files are smaller than the AgentSetup.exe file and might streamline the agent deployments.

segment.source: The command-line parameters for the AgentSetup.exe installer are supported for the Windows Installer (.msi) installation.
segment.target: The command-line parameters for the AgentSetup.exe installer are supported for the Windows Installer (.msi) installation.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: During UE-V agent installation or uninstallation you can either use the AgentSetup.exe file or the AgentSetuparch.msi file, but not both.
segment.target: During UE-V agent installation or uninstallation you can either use the AgentSetup.exe file or the AgentSetuparch.msi file, but not both.

segment.source: The same file must be used to uninstall the UE-V Agent as it was used to install the UE-V Agent.
segment.target: The same file must be used to uninstall the UE-V Agent as it was used to install the UE-V Agent.

segment.source: Be sure to use the correct variable format when you install the UE-V agent.
segment.target: Be sure to use the correct variable format when you install the UE-V agent.

segment.source: The following table provides examples of deployment options for using the AgentSetup.exe or the Windows Installer (.msi) installation files.
segment.target: The following table provides examples of deployment options for using the AgentSetup.exe or the Windows Installer (.msi) installation files.

segment.source: Deployment type
segment.target: Deployment type

segment.source: Deployment description
segment.target: Deployment description

segment.source: Example
segment.target: Example

segment.source: Command prompt
segment.target: Command prompt

segment.source: When you install the UE-V agent from a command prompt, use the %^username% variable format.
segment.target: When you install the UE-V agent from a command prompt, use the %^username% variable format.

segment.source: If quotation marks are needed because of spaces in the settings storage path, use a batch script file for deployment.
segment.target: If quotation marks are needed because of spaces in the settings storage path, use a batch script file for deployment.

segment.source: Batch script
segment.target: Batch script

segment.source: When you install the UE-V Agent from a batch script file, use the %%username%% variable format.
segment.target: When you install the UE-V Agent from a batch script file, use the %%username%% variable format.

segment.source: If you use this install method, you must escape the variable with the %% characters.
segment.target: If you use this install method, you must escape the variable with the %% characters.

segment.source: Without this character, the script expands the username variable at install time, rather than at run time, causing UE-V to use a single settings storage location for all users.
segment.target: Without this character, the script expands the username variable at install time, rather than at run time, causing UE-V to use a single settings storage location for all users.

segment.source: PowerShell
segment.target: PowerShell

segment.source: When you install the UE-V agent from a PowerShell prompt or PowerShell script, use the %username% variable format.
segment.target: When you install the UE-V agent from a PowerShell prompt or PowerShell script, use the %username% variable format.

segment.source: Electronic software distribution, such as deployment of Configuration Manager Software Deployment)
segment.target: Electronic software distribution, such as deployment of Configuration Manager Software Deployment)

segment.source: When you install the UE-V Agent with Configuration Manager, use the ^%username^% variable format.
segment.target: When you install the UE-V Agent with Configuration Manager, use the ^%username^% variable format.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The installation of the U-EV Agent requires Administrator rights and the computer will require a restart before the UE-V agent can run.
segment.target: The installation of the U-EV Agent requires Administrator rights and the computer will require a restart before the UE-V agent can run.

segment.source: UE-V Agent deployment methods from a network share
segment.target: UE-V Agent deployment methods from a network share

segment.source: You can use the following methods to deploy the UE-V agent:
segment.target: You can use the following methods to deploy the UE-V agent:

segment.source: An electronic software distribution (ESD) solution that can install a Windows Installer (.msi) file.
segment.target: An electronic software distribution (ESD) solution that can install a Windows Installer (.msi) file.

segment.source: An installation script that references the Windows Installer (.msi) file that is stored centrally on a share.
segment.target: An installation script that references the Windows Installer (.msi) file that is stored centrally on a share.

segment.source: Manually running the installation program on the computer.
segment.target: Manually running the installation program on the computer.

segment.source: To deploy the UE-V agent from a network share, use the following steps:
segment.target: To deploy the UE-V agent from a network share, use the following steps:

segment.source: To install and configure the UE-V Agent from a network share
segment.target: To install and configure the UE-V Agent from a network share

segment.source: Stage the UE-V agent installation file (AgentSetup.exe) on a network share to which users have “read” permission.
segment.target: Stage the UE-V agent installation file (AgentSetup.exe) on a network share to which users have “read” permission.

segment.source: Deploy a script to user computers that installs the UE-V agent.
segment.target: Deploy a script to user computers that installs the UE-V agent.

segment.source: The script should specify the settings storage location.
segment.target: The script should specify the settings storage location.

segment.source: Update the UE-V Agent
segment.target: Update the UE-V Agent

segment.source: Updates for the UE-V agent software will be provided through Microsoft Update.
segment.target: Updates for the UE-V agent software will be provided through Microsoft Update.

segment.source: During a UE-V agent upgrade, the default group of settings location templates for common Microsoft applications and Windows settings may be updated.
segment.target: During a UE-V agent upgrade, the default group of settings location templates for common Microsoft applications and Windows settings may be updated.

segment.source: UE-V agent updates can be deployed by using Enterprise Software Distribution (ESD) infrastructure.
segment.target: UE-V agent updates can be deployed by using Enterprise Software Distribution (ESD) infrastructure.
